headline: Coinbase Climbs App Store Rankings as Retail Interest Debate Rekindles
summary: Coinbase has surged to rank 137 in the US Apple App Store, a notable jump often seen as an early signal of rising retail interest in crypto markets. According to Sensor Tower data, the exchange’s ranking has climbed 65% over the past month, rising from 386 to 137 while Bitcoin has gained 10% during the same period. Historically, Coinbase app downloads have mirrored crypto movements . During past bull markets, Coinbase consistently entered the top 175 of app store charts, whereas ranks below 500 often aligned with prolonged bear markets. Bitcoin’s recent surge to a new all-time high of $122,884, currently trading around $118,294, has fueled speculation that retail investors might be returning. Mixed Signals on Retail Return The crypto community remains divided on whether retail is truly coming back. Crypto analyst Tony Edwards noted on X that retail is “definitely starting to come back in,” citing a spike in his YouTube analytics. Similarly, Lab4Crypto remarked that “the crowd is slowly returning,” urging investors not to miss out if this marks the beginning of a new retail wave. However, some remain cautious. André Dragosch, head of research at Bitwise, argued that “retail is almost nowhere to be found,” pointing to stagnant Google search interest for “Bitcoin” despite its price surging to new highs. Crypto trader Elisa echoed this sentiment, highlighting that Google Trends data for “crypto” remains far below the peaks seen during the 2021 bull market. Traditional Indicators May Be Losing Reliability While retail interest is often gauged through app downloads and search trends, some industry observers warn these metrics may not reflect the complete picture in the current market. The rise of spot Bitcoin and Ether ETFs has provided retail investors with alternative avenues for crypto exposure, potentially reducing the reliance on direct exchange sign-ups. Since their January 2024 launch, spot Bitcoin ETFs have amassed $53.05 billion in inflows , while spot Ether ETFs, launched in July 2024, have attracted approximately $6 billion, according to Farside data. Bitfinex analysts noted on Tuesday that new Bitcoin buyers appear to be price-agnostic, with wallets holding between 1 and 100 BTC accumulating around 19,300 BTC monthly, outpacing the 13,400 BTC monthly issuance post-April 2024 halving. The post Coinbase Climbs App Store Rankings as Retail Interest Debate Rekindles appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .
tags: Market News|Coinbase app surge|Crypto market news|Retail investors crypto

headline: Ethereum ETF: BlackRock’s ETHA Witnesses Colossal $489M Inflow, Signaling Historic Shift
summary: BitcoinWorld Ethereum ETF: BlackRock’s ETHA Witnesses Colossal $489M Inflow, Signaling Historic Shift The world of digital assets is buzzing with excitement, and for good reason! The launch of spot Ethereum ETFs has been a highly anticipated event, and BlackRock’s ETHA has just delivered a performance that has sent ripples across the entire crypto ecosystem. On July 16, this prominent Ethereum ETF recorded an astounding net inflow of $489.14 million, equivalent to 148,585 ETH. This wasn’t just another good day; it marked ETHA’s highest daily inflow since its inception, with trading volume soaring to a record $1.8 billion. This colossal surge signals a pivotal moment for institutional crypto adoption and could have a significant ETH market impact. BlackRock ETHA: A New Benchmark for Institutional Interest BlackRock, one of the world’s largest asset managers, entering the crypto space with a spot Ethereum ETF was always going to be a game-changer. Their reputation and vast network bring an unparalleled level of legitimacy and accessibility to digital assets for traditional investors. The recent inflow figures for BlackRock ETHA aren’t just numbers; they represent a powerful vote of confidence from institutional players who are increasingly recognizing the potential of Ethereum. Record-Breaking Performance: The $489.14 million net inflow on July 16 surpassed all previous daily records for ETHA, showcasing rapidly accelerating interest. Massive Trading Volume: A concurrent trading volume of $1.8 billion further underscores the high liquidity and active participation in this specific Ethereum ETF. The BlackRock Effect: BlackRock’s involvement provides a stamp of approval that resonates deeply with traditional financial institutions, often leading to a domino effect of further investment. While net flow data for other spot ETH ETFs is still awaited, ETHA’s performance alone paints a compelling picture of growing institutional appetite for Ethereum. Understanding the Significance of Spot ETH Inflows What exactly do these massive spot ETH inflows mean, and why are they so important? When an ETF experiences a net inflow, it means that investors are buying more shares of the ETF than they are selling. To accommodate this demand, the ETF issuer (in this case, BlackRock) must acquire more of the underlying asset – actual Ethereum – from the open market. This direct buying pressure can have a profound effect on the asset’s price and market dynamics. Consider the trajectory of spot Bitcoin ETFs earlier this year. Their successful launch and subsequent inflows were significant drivers of Bitcoin’s price rally, validating the concept of accessible crypto investment vehicles for a broader audience. The current trend with Ethereum ETFs, particularly BlackRock ETHA, suggests a similar pattern is emerging for the second-largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization. The consistent flow of capital into these regulated investment products indicates a long-term commitment from sophisticated investors who seek exposure to Ethereum without the complexities of direct crypto ownership. This shift from speculative retail interest to sustained institutional demand is a hallmark of market maturation. The Accelerating Trend of Institutional Crypto Investment The record inflows into BlackRock ETHA are not an isolated event but rather a clear indicator of a broader, accelerating trend: the mainstreaming of institutional crypto investment. For years, digital assets were largely viewed with skepticism by traditional finance. However, the maturation of the market, clearer regulatory frameworks (albeit still evolving), and the undeniable performance of cryptocurrencies have shifted perceptions. Institutions are now looking beyond Bitcoin to other established cryptocurrencies like Ethereum, recognizing its foundational role in decentralized finance (DeFi), NFTs, and the broader Web3 ecosystem. Ethereum’s robust developer community, ongoing technological upgrades (like the transition to Proof-of-Stake), and its utility as a programmable blockchain make it an attractive long-term investment. This wave of institutional capital brings with it not just liquidity but also increased credibility, improved infrastructure, and potentially greater price stability as the market becomes less reliant on purely retail sentiment. It’s a testament to the fact that digital assets are no longer a niche curiosity but a legitimate asset class being integrated into diversified investment portfolios. What Does This Mean for the ETH Market Impact? The immediate and long-term ETH market impact of such significant inflows from an Ethereum ETF like ETHA could be multifaceted: Price Appreciation: Direct buying pressure from the ETF on the open market can lead to an increase in Ethereum’s price. Sustained inflows suggest a strong underlying demand that could support upward price momentum. Increased Liquidity: As more institutions participate through ETFs, the overall liquidity of the ETH market improves, making it easier for large transactions to occur without significant price slippage. Reduced Volatility: While crypto markets are inherently volatile, the entrance of institutional money, often characterized by longer investment horizons and more sophisticated risk management, can gradually contribute to a more stable market environment over time. Enhanced Legitimacy: The success of spot Ethereum ETFs, particularly those from major players like BlackRock, further legitimizes Ethereum as an investable asset class, potentially attracting even more capital from cautious institutional investors. Network Development: A healthier market and increased investment can also indirectly benefit the Ethereum network itself, encouraging further development, innovation, and adoption of its underlying technology. While past performance is not indicative of future results, the precedent set by Bitcoin ETFs suggests a positive correlation between sustained ETF inflows and the underlying asset’s market performance. Looking Ahead: Challenges and Opportunities for Ethereum ETFs Despite the current euphoria, the journey for Ethereum ETFs and the broader institutional crypto landscape isn’t without its challenges. Regulatory clarity remains an ongoing process in many jurisdictions, and market dynamics can shift rapidly. However, the opportunities presented by these investment vehicles are immense. The success of BlackRock ETHA could pave the way for other asset managers to see similar success with their own spot ETH ETFs, leading to a competitive market that benefits investors through lower fees and more diverse offerings. It also sets a precedent for potential spot ETFs for other major cryptocurrencies in the future. For investors, these ETFs offer a regulated, accessible, and often more secure way to gain exposure to Ethereum’s growth story. As the digital economy continues to evolve, the integration of traditional finance with decentralized technologies through products like the Ethereum ETF will be crucial for broader adoption and innovation. Conclusion: A New Era for Ethereum Investment The colossal $489.14 million net inflow into BlackRock’s ETHA on July 16 marks a truly historic moment for the Ethereum ecosystem and the broader cryptocurrency market. This record-breaking event underscores the surging institutional crypto interest and highlights the growing confidence in Ethereum as a legitimate and valuable asset. The impact of these substantial spot ETH inflows is likely to resonate across the ETH market, influencing price, liquidity, and overall market sentiment. As institutional capital continues to flow into these regulated investment products, we are witnessing a significant evolution in how the world perceives and interacts with digital assets. This isn’t just about a single ETF’s success; it’s about the accelerating mainstream adoption of a technology poised to redefine our financial future. To learn more about the latest Ethereum ETF trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Ethereum institutional adoption . This post Ethereum ETF: BlackRock’s ETHA Witnesses Colossal $489M Inflow, Signaling Historic Shift first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: Hedge Funds Are Dumping Bank Stocks and Piling Into One Sector, Says Goldman Sachs: Report
summary: Wall Street titan Goldman Sachs says hedge funds are cutting back investments in bank stocks. Citing data from Goldman Sachs prime brokerage desk, Reuters reports hedge funds dumped bank stocks for the second straight week and bought consumer staple stocks at the fastest pace in nearly two years. The funds are exiting long positions in US banks and global financial services companies while adding short positions on European financial stocks. Goldman says banks, financial services firms and insurance companies were net sold while those involved in trading and consumer finance were net bought. The moves come as Wall Street’s record rally is set to be put to the test this week, as major banks release their second-quarter earnings reports. Meanwhile, hedge funds are buying consumer staples, which include food, beverages and tobacco that tend to be insulated from economic downturns because they are essential items. Goldman says this is the most net-bought stock sector at the Goldman Sachs prime brokerage desk this month. headline: Thailand Crypto Sandbox: Unlocking Revolutionary Digital Payments for Tourists
summary: BitcoinWorld Thailand Crypto Sandbox: Unlocking Revolutionary Digital Payments for Tourists Imagine stepping off the plane in Thailand, ready to explore its stunning beaches and vibrant culture, but instead of fumbling for local currency, you seamlessly convert your digital assets into Thai Baht right on your phone. This isn’t a futuristic dream; it’s becoming a reality. Thailand is launching a groundbreaking Thailand Crypto Sandbox designed specifically for tourists, signaling a new era for digital finance in one of the world’s most beloved travel destinations. This innovative move aims to blend the convenience of cryptocurrencies with the traditional tourism experience, making travel smoother and more modern for visitors. Thailand Crypto Sandbox: A Gateway to Digital Tourism Thailand, a nation celebrated for its hospitality and beautiful landscapes, is now stepping onto the global stage as a pioneer in digital finance innovation for tourism. The country’s Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the central bank are spearheading a new regulatory sandbox. This initiative is a controlled environment where foreign tourists can convert their cryptocurrencies into Thai Baht for local spending. The goal is clear: to leverage digital assets to boost the vital tourism sector, which is a significant pillar of Thailand’s economy. This sandbox will operate through licensed platforms and regulated e-money services. While direct crypto payments for goods and services remain prohibited, the ability to convert crypto into fiat currency on demand is a massive leap forward. It addresses a key pain point for international travelers: currency exchange. By offering a secure and regulated channel for Thailand Crypto Sandbox participants, the nation hopes to attract a new wave of tech-savvy tourists and enhance their overall travel experience. It’s about making transactions simpler and more efficient, reducing reliance on traditional banking hours or physical exchange booths. Seamless Crypto to Baht Conversion: How Will It Work? The core of this exciting initiative is the Crypto to Baht Conversion process. For foreign tourists, the mechanism is designed to be user-friendly and secure. Here’s a breakdown of how it’s expected to function: Licensed Platforms: Tourists will use approved, licensed cryptocurrency platforms or digital asset exchanges operating within Thailand. These platforms will be under the strict oversight of the SEC and the central bank, ensuring compliance and security. E-Money Services Integration: Once converted, the Thai Baht will be transferred to regulated e-money services or digital wallets. These services are widely accepted across Thailand, from major retailers to local markets, making spending convenient. No Direct Crypto Payments: It’s crucial to understand that this is not about paying directly with Bitcoin or Ethereum at a street vendor. Instead, it’s about converting your crypto into usable Thai Baht, which then functions like any other digital payment or cash. This distinction helps manage regulatory risks while still providing the benefit of using digital assets. The benefits of this seamless Crypto to Baht Conversion are numerous. Tourists can potentially avoid traditional foreign exchange fees, benefit from competitive exchange rates offered by regulated platforms, and enjoy the convenience of not carrying large amounts of cash. It also provides a level of security, as digital transactions are traceable and less susceptible to theft than physical cash. This innovation could redefine how modern travelers manage their finances abroad. Boosting Thailand Tourism: A Vision for the Future The primary driver behind the Thailand Tourism Boost initiative is economic revitalization. Tourism is a cornerstone of Thailand’s economy, contributing significantly to its GDP and employment. By embracing digital finance, Thailand aims to: Attract a New Demographic: The global cryptocurrency community is growing, comprising individuals who are often digitally native and seek convenience. By offering crypto-friendly solutions, Thailand positions itself as a forward-thinking destination for this lucrative market segment. Enhance Competitiveness: In an increasingly competitive global tourism market, innovation is key. This sandbox provides Thailand with a unique selling proposition, differentiating it from countries that have not yet embraced digital assets in a regulated manner. Increase Spending Efficiency: By making it easier for tourists to access and spend local currency, the initiative could encourage higher spending, benefiting local businesses, hotels, and service providers across the country. This strategic move is not just about short-term gains; it’s about solidifying Thailand’s position as a modern, digitally advanced travel hub. The government sees this as an investment in the future of its tourism industry, adapting to the evolving preferences of international travelers and ensuring a sustainable Thailand Tourism Boost for years to come. Navigating Digital Currency Payments: What Tourists Need to Know While the prospect of utilizing Digital Currency Payments in Thailand is exciting, tourists should be aware of a few key considerations to ensure a smooth experience: Use Licensed Platforms: Always ensure you are using a digital asset exchange or service provider that is officially licensed and regulated by the Thai SEC and central bank. Information on approved entities will be made available as the sandbox rolls out. Understand Fees and Rates: Like any currency exchange, there may be transaction fees or exchange rate spreads. Compare options to get the best value for your crypto conversion. Security Best Practices: Protect your digital wallets and exchange accounts with strong, unique passwords and two-factor authentication (2FA). Be cautious of phishing attempts or unofficial services claiming to offer crypto conversion. Know Your Limits: Be aware of any daily or transaction limits that might be imposed by the regulatory framework or the service providers themselves. Stay Informed: The regulatory landscape for digital assets can evolve. Keep an eye on official announcements from Thai authorities or reputable news sources regarding the sandbox’s operation and any updates to the rules for Digital Currency Payments . By following these guidelines, tourists can confidently navigate the new system, enjoying the benefits of digital finance without unnecessary risks. This initiative is about empowering tourists with more payment flexibility, not exposing them to unregulated markets. Evolving Crypto Regulations Thailand: Setting a Precedent? The launch of the crypto-to-baht sandbox is a significant development in the broader landscape of Crypto Regulations Thailand . Thailand has been progressive in its approach to digital assets, establishing clear legal frameworks for cryptocurrencies and digital tokens earlier than many other nations. This sandbox further demonstrates a pragmatic approach: recognizing the potential benefits of crypto while mitigating risks through controlled environments. This move positions Thailand as a leader in creating practical, use-case-driven crypto regulations. Unlike some countries that have taken a more restrictive stance, Thailand is exploring how digital assets can directly contribute to economic growth, specifically within its vital tourism sector. This balanced approach could set a precedent for other nations grappling with how to integrate cryptocurrencies into their mainstream economies. The sandbox allows regulators to observe real-world usage, gather data, and refine policies before potentially broader implementation. It’s a smart, iterative approach to navigating the complexities of digital finance. The success of this initiative could influence future Crypto Regulations Thailand , potentially paving the way for more widespread adoption of digital assets within the country’s financial ecosystem, beyond just tourism. A New Horizon for Travel and Finance Thailand’s decision to launch a crypto-to-baht sandbox for tourists is more than just a regulatory experiment; it’s a bold statement about the future of travel and finance. By embracing digital innovation, Thailand is not only simplifying transactions for international visitors but also strategically boosting its crucial tourism sector. This move highlights a forward-thinking approach to integrating emerging technologies into traditional industries, setting a potential benchmark for other nations. As the sandbox rolls out, it promises to offer unprecedented convenience for travelers, allowing them to leverage their digital assets in a secure and regulated environment. While direct crypto payments are still off-limits, the ability to seamlessly convert crypto to local currency for spending is a game-changer. This initiative underscores Thailand’s commitment to being at the forefront of digital transformation, ensuring its place as a top destination for the modern, globally connected traveler. The future of tourism is digital, and Thailand is leading the way. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping the digital finance landscape and institutional adoption. This post Thailand Crypto Sandbox: Unlocking Revolutionary Digital Payments for Tourists first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team
tags: Crypto News|Blockchain Regulations|Crypto Tourism|digital finance|Thailand Crypto|Tourist Payments

headline: Burchett and Trump agree on private crypto transactions
summary: US Representative Tim Burchett says they agreed with President Trump to maintain the anonymity of crypto transactions, similar to how cash works. In a Thursday X post, the Tennessee representative commented , “Late night agreement with ⁦Donald Trump⁩ and leadership to keep your crypto transactions private like cash.” Crypto bills stalled in the House after some Republicans moved to support Democrats Lately, the Trump administration and Republican representatives have been focused on setting friendly regulations for the industry. This week, the so-called “crypto week,” the House was slated to advance three bills endorsed by President Trump, who argued they would propel the US to be the global crypto capital. However, Tuesday’s legislative push hit a snag as some Republicans joined Democrats to stop the procedural vote. Though Trump weighed in during a late evening meeting with GOP members at the White House, seemingly reviving the bills. He posted on Truth Social that he expected the bills to come up for a vote by Wednesday. Late night agreement with ⁦ @realDonaldTrump ⁩ and leadership to keep your crypto transactions private like cash. pic.twitter.com/ILXouDofWO — Tim Burchett (@timburchett) July 17, 2025 Still, Republicans were grappling with internal divisions in their Wednesday discussions. Conservative republicans held out, demanding that the crypto market structure bill explicitly ban the Federal Reserve from creating a digital dollar. Burchett, one of the GOP hardliners, said they were under the impression an agreement had been made to satisfy their demands, but it soon fell through. He noted that some wanted the agreement in writing, and others didn’t agree with the deal. He added, “So you’ve got people that are just upset.” GOP hardliners were pushing to merge the crypto market structure bill, the CLARITY Act , with the other bill to ban a central digital currency. However, a pro-crypto Democrat warned that combining the two bills might cost crucial Democratic support and risk their passage in the Senate. Nevertheless, House Republicans advanced the three crypto bills and the 2026 defense spending plan despite tense negotiations. Republican leaders agreed to include a CBDC ban in the must-pass defense authorization bill, securing support from GOP hardliners. President Trump seemed pleased with the agreement they made. Speaker Mike Johnson also expressed his relief that the stalemate was finally over. The House has now cleared a procedural hurdle that opens the door to passing crypto legislation. Johnson expects to take up the Senate’s stablecoin legislation, the GENIUS Act, on Thursday, while action on the CLARITY bill may be delayed. The GENIUS Act, if approved, will move on to Trump’s desk and become the first major crypto bill ever passed by Congress. The crypto community shows mixed reactions to Burchett’s post Nonetheless, the administration seems open to discussing more digital assets. Burchett claimed they agreed with Trump to keep crypto transactions private. Some X users supported the move, while others did not appreciate it that much. One X user argued that keeping the transactions would encourage money laundering. Another user even asked if they could get their taxes back. A user named Charles Keller even suggested that digital assets eventually can lead to the dollar’s fall, saying they already see signs of possible instability. Meanwhile, one stated that it would be impossible to let crypto stay private. Several commentators, however, thanked the Tennessee Representative, asking him to continue with the good work. Others expressed happiness that the White House is working closely with the Representatives. KEY Difference Wire helps crypto brands break through and dominate headlines fast

headline: Abraxas Capital Faces Staggering $131M Loss on Crypto Shorts
summary: BitcoinWorld Abraxas Capital Faces Staggering $131M Loss on Crypto Shorts The world of cryptocurrency trading is often described as a wild west, full of immense opportunities and equally immense risks. This sentiment has been starkly highlighted by recent revelations surrounding Abraxas Capital , a firm now reportedly grappling with a colossal financial setback. On-chain analytics platform Onchain Lens, a prominent voice in the crypto community, recently dropped a bombshell on X (formerly Twitter): two Hyperliquid addresses, strongly suspected to be linked to Abraxas Capital, are holding a portfolio of short positions across various cryptocurrencies, accumulating more than $131 million in unrealized losses . This isn’t just a ripple; it’s a significant wave that sends shivers down the spines of traders and investors alike, underscoring the precarious nature of high-stakes crypto ventures. What Exactly Are Unrealized Losses and Short Positions? To truly grasp the gravity of Abraxas Capital’s situation, it’s crucial to understand the fundamental concepts at play: short selling and the distinction between realized and unrealized losses . Imagine you believe the price of an asset, say Bitcoin, is going to fall. In traditional investing, you’d simply avoid buying it. But in the world of short selling, you can actually profit from a price decline. Short Selling Mechanics: To short an asset, you typically borrow it from a broker or exchange, sell it at the current market price, and then wait for its price to drop. If your prediction is correct, you then buy the asset back at a lower price and return it to the lender, pocketing the difference. It sounds simple, but the risks are profound. The Peril of Unlimited Loss: While the profit potential in shorting is limited (an asset can only fall to zero), the loss potential is theoretically unlimited. If the asset’s price rises instead of falls, you’re still obligated to buy it back and return it, meaning you’ll have to purchase it at a higher price than you sold it for. The higher it goes, the more you lose. Unrealized vs. Realized Losses: This is a critical distinction. An unrealized loss is a paper loss; it exists as long as the position is open and the market moves against you. It’s the difference between your entry price and the current market price. A realized loss, however, occurs when you close the position, locking in that loss. Abraxas Capital’s reported $131 million is an unrealized loss, meaning they haven’t yet closed these positions, but they are deep in the red based on current market prices. This also implies they might be facing significant margin calls, where they need to deposit more collateral to maintain their positions, or risk forced liquidation. The sheer scale of these unrealized losses underscores the extreme volatility inherent in the crypto market, where prices can swing wildly in short periods, making crypto short positions particularly perilous. The On-Chain Revelation: How On-Chain Analytics Uncovered the Story In the transparent yet often opaque world of decentralized finance (DeFi), on-chain analytics platforms serve as powerful investigative tools. Onchain Lens, in this instance, demonstrated the immense value they bring to the crypto ecosystem. But how do they do it? Public Ledgers, Private Identities: Blockchain transactions are public, recorded on an immutable ledger. Every transfer, every trade, every loan is visible. What often remains private, however, is the identity behind the wallet addresses. The Art of De-Anonymization: On-chain analytics firms like Onchain Lens specialize in de-anonymizing these addresses. They use sophisticated algorithms, heuristics, and often, publicly available information (like previous statements from firms about their wallet addresses, or large, identifiable movements of funds to and from known entities) to link specific addresses to real-world entities or individuals. While they haven’t publicly detailed their methodology for linking these specific Hyperliquid addresses to Abraxas Capital, it likely involves tracing funds, identifying patterns, or leveraging previously known associations. Transparency in Action: This incident highlights the double-edged sword of blockchain transparency. While it offers unparalleled visibility into market movements and financial flows, it also exposes the positions and sometimes the missteps of large players. For investors and the broader market, this transparency can be invaluable for understanding market dynamics and identifying potential risks or opportunities. The ability of on-chain analytics to shed light on such significant financial positions underscores a paradigm shift in financial scrutiny, moving from traditional regulatory oversight to a more decentralized, community-driven form of accountability. Hyperliquid and the Risky Bet: A Deep Dive into the Platform The reported short positions were held on Hyperliquid, a decentralized perpetuals exchange. This choice of platform is significant, as it adds another layer of risk and complexity to Abraxas Capital’s strategy. Decentralized Perpetual Futures: Hyperliquid is a decentralized exchange (DEX) that allows users to trade perpetual futures contracts. Unlike traditional futures, perpetuals don’t have an expiry date, mimicking spot trading while offering leverage. Being a DEX means trades are executed directly on the blockchain, and users typically retain custody of their funds. The Allure of Leverage: Platforms like Hyperliquid offer substantial leverage, allowing traders to control large positions with a relatively small amount of capital. While this amplifies potential profits, it equally amplifies potential losses. A small adverse price movement can lead to significant losses, and in extreme cases, liquidation of the entire collateral. For institutional players, the appeal might be perceived anonymity or lower fees compared to centralized exchanges, alongside the ability to execute large trades. Risks Amplified on DEXs: While DEXs offer benefits like self-custody and censorship resistance, they also come with unique risks. Smart contract vulnerabilities, network congestion, and the rapid pace of liquidation mechanisms can pose significant challenges, especially for large, leveraged positions. Abraxas Capital’s choice to place such a substantial bet on Hyperliquid , a platform known for its high leverage offerings, suggests a high-risk, high-reward strategy that, in this instance, appears to have backfired spectacularly. The Assets in Play: BTC, ETH, SOL, SUI, HYPE, and FARTCOIN The portfolio of short positions held by the addresses linked to Abraxas Capital is diverse, ranging from blue-chip cryptocurrencies to highly speculative assets. This mix reveals a multi-faceted bearish outlook, but also an incredible appetite for risk. Asset Category Potential Reason for Shorting (General) BTC (Bitcoin) Major Cryptocurrency Broader market bearish sentiment, macroeconomic concerns, profit-taking after rallies. ETH (Ethereum) Major Cryptocurrency / DeFi Ecosystem Similar to BTC, potential regulatory concerns, competition from other L1s. SOL (Solana) Layer 1 Blockchain Concerns over network stability, competitive landscape, specific project FUD. SUI Newer Layer 1 Blockchain Post-launch volatility, tokenomics concerns, overall altcoin market weakness. HYPE Speculative/Memecoin (likely) Extreme volatility, high speculation, ‘pump and dump’ potential, lack of fundamental value. FARTCOIN Speculative/Memecoin (likely) Pure speculation, often zero fundamental value, extreme risk, susceptibility to sudden dumps. While shorting major cryptocurrencies like BTC and ETH can be part of a broader hedging or bearish strategy, the inclusion of assets like HYPE and FARTCOIN is particularly telling. These are often memecoins or highly speculative, low-cap tokens known for their extreme price swings and often driven by pure hype rather than utility. Shorting such assets is akin to playing with fire, as they can experience parabolic pumps against all logic, leading to rapid and devastating losses for short sellers. This highlights a strategy that wasn’t just bearish on the market but also highly aggressive and speculative, leading to these substantial crypto short positions . The Broader Implications for Abraxas Capital and the Market A reported $131 million in unrealized losses is not merely a number; it carries significant implications for Abraxas Capital and potentially sends ripples across the crypto market. Financial Strain and Margin Calls: For a capital firm, such a large unrealized loss puts immense pressure on its balance sheet. It likely triggers significant margin calls, requiring the firm to deposit additional capital to maintain its short positions. Failure to meet these calls could lead to forced liquidation of their positions, turning unrealized losses into very real, painful ones. Reputational Damage: In the financial world, reputation is paramount. News of such substantial losses, especially in a volatile and often scrutinized sector like crypto, can severely damage a firm’s credibility. It might erode investor trust, deter potential clients, and raise questions about their risk management strategies and overall investment acumen. Market Sentiment and Contagion Risk: While one firm’s losses might not directly crash the entire market, significant setbacks for institutional players can affect overall sentiment. If the losses are realized and lead to large-scale liquidations, it could add selling pressure to the market. More broadly, it serves as a cautionary tale, reminding other institutional players of the extreme risks involved in highly leveraged crypto trading. Regulatory Scrutiny: Large financial losses, especially those publicly revealed through on-chain data, can attract the attention of financial regulators. While decentralized exchanges operate in a complex regulatory landscape, the scale of the reported losses could prompt closer examination of the firm’s crypto activities. This incident serves as a stark reminder that even sophisticated financial entities are not immune to the market’s brutal realities, especially when engaging in high-leverage crypto short positions . Navigating Crypto Volatility: Lessons from Massive Crypto Short Positions The reported predicament of Abraxas Capital offers invaluable lessons for both individual traders and institutional investors operating in the cryptocurrency space. The market’s inherent volatility, coupled with the allure of high leverage, creates a potent cocktail of opportunity and extreme risk. Mastering Risk Management: This is arguably the most critical takeaway. No matter how confident you are in your market outlook, robust risk management is non-negotiable. This includes setting clear stop-loss orders, proper position sizing (never risking more than a small percentage of your capital on a single trade), and understanding your liquidation price. For short positions, where losses are theoretically unlimited, these measures are even more vital. Understanding Market Cycles: Cryptocurrencies are known for their dramatic bull and bear cycles. While shorting can be profitable in a bear market, attempting to short a market that is fundamentally in an uptrend, or one prone to sudden, powerful rallies (often called ‘short squeezes’), is exceedingly dangerous. The Double-Edged Sword of Leverage: While leverage can magnify profits, it equally magnifies losses. The higher the leverage, the smaller the price movement required to wipe out your capital. Responsible use of leverage, or even avoiding it entirely, is often the wisest path for most participants. Due Diligence on Platforms: While Hyperliquid is a legitimate DEX, understanding the specific mechanics, liquidation protocols, and potential smart contract risks of any platform you use is essential, especially for large sums. The Psychology of Trading: Fear of missing out (FOMO) and fear of losing (FOL) can drive irrational decisions. In the face of mounting unrealized losses , the psychological pressure to hold on, hoping for a reversal, can be immense. This often leads to even greater losses. Having a clear trading plan and sticking to it, regardless of emotions, is paramount. The Value of On-Chain Transparency: For the broader market, this incident reinforces the power of on-chain analytics . It provides an unprecedented level of transparency, allowing the community to monitor significant movements and positions, which can act as an early warning system or provide valuable market insights. Conclusion: A Wake-Up Call for High-Stakes Trading The alleged $131 million in unrealized losses faced by Abraxas Capital on their Hyperliquid short positions serves as a potent reminder of the volatile and often unforgiving nature of the cryptocurrency markets. It highlights the immense risks associated with high-leverage trading, particularly when betting against the market on a diverse portfolio that includes highly speculative assets like memecoins. The transparency offered by on-chain analytics platforms like Onchain Lens brings these high-stakes plays into the public eye, offering valuable lessons for all market participants. While the allure of significant returns in crypto is undeniable, this incident underscores the critical importance of rigorous risk management, a deep understanding of market dynamics, and a healthy respect for the unpredictable forces that can turn potential gains into staggering losses. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action. headline: Former NCA officer bags 5-year sentence for stealing Silk Road BTC
summary: A former NCA officer got sentenced to five and a half years in prison after admitting he stole 50 BTC (currently worth around £4.4 million) seized as part of a crackdown on illegal dark web marketplaces. Paul Chowles, 42, is an ex-NCA officer who worked with the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) to target organized criminals operating on the Silk Road in 2013. That first operation led to drug convictions for several UK suspects. A picture of Paul Chowles. Source: CPS UK NCA officer moved Silk Road BTC In 2014, investigators launched a 2nd phase that uncovered “Silk Road 2.0,” set up by Thomas White within one month of the FBI’s closure of the Silk Road. White later received a 64-month prison sentence in April 2019. In that team, Chowles was responsible for analyzing and extracting crypto and data from White’s devices. According to the records, 50 BTC out of 97 BTC taken from White’s “retirement wallet” were moved in two large transfers to another public address from May 6 – 7, 2017. Those coins were then split into smaller sums and run through “Bitcoin Fog,” a known money‑laundering mixer, before being transferred to other wallets to obscure their origin. Once the trail was blurred, Chowles converted some of the BTC into pounds and withdrew cash. He also set up accounts with Cryptopay and Wirex, using their debit cards to spend and withdraw funds. From August 26, 2021, until May 20, 2022. He made 279 purchases totaling £23,309 on his Cryptopay card. He also made five cash withdrawals amounting to £6,232 from August 30, 2021 until February 22, 2022. Meanwhile, his Wirex card racked up transactions adding up to £79,884.77 from August 27, 2021 to July 14, 2021. The flow of stolen BTC. Source: Chainalysis Altogether, Chowles profited by £613,147.29 from his criminal actions, according to the investigators. Today, the market value of the total stolen BTC exceeds £4.4 million. Chowles confessed to his crime at Liverpool Crown Court in May 2025. He pleaded guilty to various charges, including thievery and transfers and concealment of criminal funds. Finally, he received a sentence of 5.5 years on July 16. White helped nab Paul Chowles After White’s 97 Bitcoins were seized, investigators first thought he had removed the 50 tokens by himself. By late 2021, the missing Bitcoins were written off as lost. Later, during investigations, White pointed out that only someone inside the NCA with access to his private keys could have taken the missing coins. Merseyside officers, who manage White’s license, met NCA colleagues, including Chowles, to review the case. It was at that meeting that their attention turned towards the stolen 50 Bitcoins. An investigation by Merseyside Police followed, leading to Chowles’s arrest. Officers seized his iPhone, linking him to the transfer account, and showed browser history for a crypto exchange. They also found notebooks in his office containing details such as statements, usernames, and passwords, tied to White’s accounts. According to specialist prosecutor Alex Johnson, Chowles was someone with a competent and technical mind who had great knowledge of crypto and the dark net. Johnson added, “He abused that trust to fill his own pockets.” KEY Difference Wire : the secret tool crypto projects use to get guaranteed media coverage

headline: Mysterious Bitcoin Whale Strikes Again! Thousands of Bitcoin Moved to a Different Address! Is a Sale Coming?
summary: The “OG Bitcoin whale,” considered one of the crypto world's oldest and most mysterious asset holders, is back on the move after 14 years of silence. “OG Bitcoin Whale” Awakes After 14 Years, Moves Another 40,000 BTC: Is He Preparing to Sell? According to blockchain data, 40,192 BTC (approximately $4.75 billion) was transferred from whale addresses to a new address early this morning. This mysterious whale first moved approximately 80,000 BTC ($9.5 billion) across eight different addresses on July 4, 2025. These transfers, each containing 10,000 BTC, caused a stir in the crypto community. Two days earlier, 40,010 of these BTC were sent to two addresses identified by chain analysis firm Arkham as belonging to Galaxy Digital. Some of the funds were later distributed to crypto exchange OKX and unlabeled addresses. The remainder remains held in Galaxy Digital addresses. New Transfer: Sell Signal? As of 4:33 AM today, the remaining 40,192 BTC, previously distributed equally across four different addresses (“bc1qn”, “bc1qy”, “bc1qm”, “1GcCK”), were consolidated into a new address (“bc1qs…”). Prior to the transfer, test transactions of 1 BTC were conducted on Tuesday and Wednesday. According to analytics firm Lookonchain, this new consolidation move could indicate the whale is planning to continue selling. Galaxy Digital’s OTC (over-the-counter) services allow users to sell large amounts of crypto privately without sending them directly to exchanges. Who Could Be the Whale? While various theories circulate regarding the identity of this mysterious whale, from Roger Ver to the CIA and even Satoshi Nakamoto, Coinbase executive Conor Grogan states that the whale was likely an early Bitcoin miner in 2011. At the time, the block reward was 50 BTC and there was much less competition on the network. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Mysterious Bitcoin Whale Strikes Again! Thousands of Bitcoin Moved to a Different Address! Is a Sale Coming?

headline: Altcoin Season Index Plummets to 38: Decoding Bitcoin’s Dominance in the Crypto Market
summary: BitcoinWorld Altcoin Season Index Plummets to 38: Decoding Bitcoin’s Dominance in the Crypto Market The cryptocurrency world is constantly shifting, and understanding these shifts is crucial for any investor. Recently, a key indicator, the Altcoin Season Index , has dropped to 38, signaling a significant period for the market. This isn’t just a number; it’s a clear message that we are currently deep into what’s known as Bitcoin Season, a time when the king of crypto asserts its dominance over the myriad of alternative coins. What does this mean for your portfolio, and how should you navigate these prevailing crypto market trends ? Understanding the Altcoin Season Index : What Does 38 Mean? To truly grasp the current state of the market, it’s essential to understand the metric guiding our insights: the Altcoin Season Index. This valuable tool, meticulously tracked by the cryptocurrency price data platform CoinMarketCap (CMC), provides a snapshot of the broader market sentiment and asset performance. On July 17, at 00:30 UTC, the index registered a reading of 38, a figure that remained unchanged from the previous day. This low number is a direct indicator of the market’s current leanings. Here’s a breakdown of how this index works and what its current reading signifies: Exclusions: The index specifically filters out stablecoins (like USDT or USDC) and wrapped tokens (like wBTC) to provide a clearer picture of genuine market sentiment and speculative asset performance. Comparison Basis: It meticulously compares the performance of the top 100 cryptocurrencies listed on CoinMarketCap over the past 90 days. This 90-day window offers a robust view, smoothing out daily volatility to reveal underlying trends. Defining Seasons: The index has clear thresholds for determining market seasons: Altcoin Season: For the market to be declared in Altcoin Season, a remarkable 75% or more of these top 100 altcoins must have outperformed Bitcoin over the 90-day period. This signifies broad-based altcoin strength. Bitcoin Season: Conversely, Bitcoin Season is declared when 25% or fewer of the top 100 altcoins manage to outperform Bitcoin. A score of 38, as we see now, falls squarely within this range, indicating that Bitcoin is largely overshadowing its smaller counterparts. Score Range: The index operates on a scale from 1 to 100, with higher numbers indicating stronger altcoin performance relative to Bitcoin, and lower numbers signaling Bitcoin’s dominance. A score of 38 emphatically confirms that Bitcoin has been the dominant force, soaking up capital and attention, while most altcoins struggle to keep pace. Navigating Bitcoin Season : Why Dominance Matters When the Altcoin Season Index points towards Bitcoin Season, it’s not just an academic observation; it has tangible implications for the entire market. Bitcoin Season typically occurs for several reasons, and understanding them can help investors make more informed decisions. During a Bitcoin Season: Flight to Safety: In times of uncertainty or market consolidation, investors often view Bitcoin as the safest bet in the volatile crypto space. Its larger market capitalization, established infrastructure, and first-mover advantage make it a preferred store of value. Capital tends to flow out of riskier altcoins and into Bitcoin. Halving Cycles: Bitcoin’s halving events, which reduce the supply of new BTC, historically precede bull runs. The anticipation and post-halving effects often lead to Bitcoin outperforming altcoins as investors front-run or react to the supply shock. Institutional Interest: A growing number of institutional investors are entering the crypto space, and many start with Bitcoin due to its liquidity and regulatory clarity (or perceived clarity compared to altcoins). This influx of institutional capital disproportionately benefits Bitcoin. Liquidity Concentration: As Bitcoin gains momentum, trading volume often concentrates around BTC pairs, making it easier for large players to enter and exit positions without significant price slippage. This further reinforces its dominance. The current Bitcoin Season means that, for the vast majority of the top 100 altcoins, their performance has lagged behind Bitcoin’s over the last three months. This isn’t necessarily a sign of weakness in altcoins themselves, but rather a reflection of Bitcoin’s superior momentum and market preference during this specific period. Analyzing Crypto Market Trends : Beyond the Index While the Altcoin Season Index provides a quantitative measure, it’s crucial to look at broader crypto market trends to understand the full picture. The index is a symptom, not the sole cause, of market dynamics. Several macroeconomic and industry-specific factors contribute to the current state of Bitcoin dominance. Consider these overarching trends: Global Economic Headwinds: High inflation, rising interest rates, and geopolitical tensions can lead investors to de-risk. In the crypto space, this often translates to a shift from speculative altcoins to Bitcoin, which is perceived as a less volatile asset within the crypto ecosystem. Regulatory Scrutiny: Increased regulatory focus on cryptocurrencies can create uncertainty, particularly for newer or less established altcoins. Bitcoin, having been around longer, often faces less direct regulatory pressure or has clearer guidelines, making it more attractive. Technological Advancements in Bitcoin: Innovations like the Lightning Network and the growing adoption of Bitcoin as a payment rail or a sovereign asset continue to strengthen its utility and appeal, attracting more users and capital. Narrative Shifts: The prevailing market narrative can heavily influence investor behavior. If the narrative emphasizes Bitcoin’s role as ‘digital gold’ or an inflation hedge, capital will naturally gravitate towards it. Understanding these underlying trends helps contextualize why Bitcoin is currently leading the charge and why the Altcoin Season Index reflects this reality. It’s a complex interplay of internal crypto dynamics and external economic forces. Impact on Altcoin Performance : Strategies for Investors With Bitcoin firmly in the driver’s seat, what does this mean for altcoin performance , and more importantly, for your investment strategy? While Bitcoin Season can be challenging for altcoin holders, it also presents unique opportunities for those who understand how to adapt. Here’s how Bitcoin Season typically impacts altcoins and what investors can consider: Underperformance: The most direct impact is that the majority of altcoins will likely underperform Bitcoin. This means even if altcoins see price increases, Bitcoin’s gains will be proportionally larger. Increased Volatility: Smaller altcoins, especially those with lower liquidity, can experience amplified volatility during Bitcoin Season. They might see sharper declines when Bitcoin dips and slower recoveries. Capital Rotation: While capital is flowing into Bitcoin, it doesn’t mean altcoins are dead. It often signifies a period of consolidation. Smart money might be accumulating specific altcoins at lower prices, anticipating the eventual shift back to Altcoin Season. Actionable Insights for Investors: During Bitcoin Season, consider these strategies: Rebalance Your Portfolio: Evaluate your asset allocation. If your portfolio is heavily weighted towards altcoins, you might consider rebalancing to increase your Bitcoin exposure. Focus on Strong Fundamentals: This is a crucial time to research altcoins with robust technology, strong development teams, active communities, and clear use cases. Projects that can weather the Bitcoin dominance are likely to perform well when the tide turns. Dollar-Cost Averaging (DCA): Instead of trying to time the bottom, consider dollar-cost averaging into your preferred altcoins. This strategy helps mitigate risk by spreading your investments over time. Profit-Taking from Bitcoin: If you’ve enjoyed significant gains from Bitcoin’s run, consider taking some profits and potentially rotating a small portion into promising altcoins that are currently undervalued. Patience is Key: Market cycles are natural. Bitcoin Season is often followed by Altcoin Season. Patience and a long-term perspective are vital during these periods. Understanding the nuances of altcoin performance during this period can help you avoid panic selling and instead position yourself for future growth. Leveraging CoinMarketCap Data for Informed Decisions The Altcoin Season Index, provided by CoinMarketCap , is just one of many powerful tools available on the platform for making informed decisions. CMC is a treasure trove of data that, when utilized effectively, can give investors a significant edge. Here’s how you can leverage CoinMarketCap data: Market Capitalization: Track the total market cap of Bitcoin versus altcoins. A rising Bitcoin dominance percentage on CMC’s charts reinforces the Bitcoin Season narrative. Volume Analysis: Look at trading volumes. High volume on Bitcoin, especially relative to altcoins, indicates strong interest and liquidity. Individual Coin Performance: Dive into the performance of individual altcoins. See which ones are holding up better than others, which might indicate underlying strength or specific narratives. Historical Data: Use CMC’s historical data to analyze past Bitcoin and Altcoin Seasons. Understanding past cycles can provide insights into potential future movements. Watchlists and Portfolios: Utilize CMC’s features to create watchlists for coins you are interested in and track your portfolio’s performance against the broader market trends. By actively engaging with the data provided by CoinMarketCap , investors can move beyond mere speculation and base their strategies on concrete market information, helping them navigate both Bitcoin and Altcoin Seasons more effectively. Conclusion: Riding the Waves of Crypto Seasons The Altcoin Season Index at 38 is a clear signal that the cryptocurrency market is currently experiencing a strong Bitcoin Season. This period is characterized by Bitcoin’s outperformance of the vast majority of altcoins, driven by factors ranging from a flight to safety and institutional interest to broader macroeconomic trends. While this might seem challenging for altcoin enthusiasts, it’s a natural and recurring cycle within the crypto ecosystem. Understanding these market dynamics, leveraging data from platforms like CoinMarketCap, and adopting strategic approaches like portfolio rebalancing and dollar-cost averaging are paramount. Instead of viewing Bitcoin Season as a setback, smart investors can see it as an opportunity to consolidate, research, and position themselves for the eventual return of altcoin dominance. The crypto market is a dynamic ocean; knowing how to read the currents, whether they signal Bitcoin’s might or altcoins’ surge, is the key to long-term success. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action. This post Altcoin Season Index Plummets to 38: Decoding Bitcoin’s Dominance in the Crypto Market first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: WazirX Users Could Finally Get Funds Back As Court Reverses Ruling
summary: The Singapore High Court has reversed its earlier ruling, paving the way for a WazirX revote that could lead to user crypto distribution. WazirX Given Greenlight By Court For Revote In a new post on X, Indian crypto exchange WazirX has shared details of the Singapore High Court hearing held on July 16th. The court has set aside its earlier rejection of the platform’s restructuring proposal and has approved a fast-tracked revote that could allow the exchange to open back up. WazirX closed its doors almost exactly a year ago, on July 18th, after falling prey to a notorious hack that drained it of user crypto funds amounting to $234 million. At the time, the exchange held about $500 million in its reserves, meaning almost half of its assets were wiped out. The hack was later linked with North Korean hackers part of the Lazarus Group . When the breach became known, the exchange suspended deposits and withdrawals, and to this day, these channels haven’t been reopened, although that may be about to change. WazirX has been planning a restructure through its parent company Zettai PTE LTD and during a vote, the proposal ended up finding overwhelming support from the creditors. The Singapore High Court rejected the plan during a hearing on June 4th, however, citing concerns over regulatory compliance with Singapore’s Financial Services and Markets Act (FSMA) and the involvement of Panama-based entity Zensui in the distribution process. The company amended the proposal and returned to court again. After the latest hearing, the Singapore High Court has now given its greenlight on the updated plan and allow the exchange to conduct a fast-tracked revote with its creditors. Alongside the news, Nischal Shetty , CEO of WazirX, has broken a long silence on X to comment on the outcome. “The broad amendment is that instead of Zettai, it will be Zanmai helping with the fund distribution if the scheme is approved,” noted Shetty. Zanmai Labs is the Indian entity behind WazirX that manages the Indian Rupee (INR) component of the platform. Zettai, on the other hand, was the one looking after the crypto side of things, which is why the firm has been at the center of the legal proceedings. The data of the vote will be announced soon, according to Shetty. “If the amended scheme is approved by the requisite majority of creditors and sanctioned by the court, it is contemplated that the WazirX platform will reopen,” said WazirX in the announcement. It now remains to be seen how things will develop from here and whether the platform’s users who have been waiting for their crypto for over a year will finally get it back. Bitcoin Price At the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading around $119,300, up over 8% in the last week.

headline: Coinbase Unveils ‘Super App’ To Expand Crypto Access–Details
summary: Crypto exchange Coinbase has launched a new initiative with its “Base App,” aiming to broaden access to the crypto economy. Unveiled on Wednesday, this application replaces the Coinbase Wallet and is designed to merge various functionalities, including wallet, trading, payments, messaging, and social media. Built on Coinbase’s proprietary blockchain network, Base, which operates on the Ethereum (ETH) blockchain, the app reportedly seeks to attract a wider audience beyond traditional cryptocurrency enthusiasts. Base App Launch According to CNBC, the Base App represents an opportunity to reach consumers who may not be primarily interested in buying or trading cryptocurrencies—a critical pivot given the company’s past over-reliance on trading revenues. Related Reading: BNB Price Stalls: Struggles to Resume Gains While Altcoins Rally To support the launch of the Base App, Coinbase introduced two significant features: Base Account, an identity verification system, and Base Pay, an express checkout tool designed for payments using the Circle-issued USDC stablecoin. During the unveiling event, Alex Danco, a product manager at Shopify, highlighted that “tens of thousands” of merchants can now utilize this feature, with plans for a broader rollout in the coming months. Additionally, Shopify intends to offer 1% cash back on USDC payments made through Base, further incentivizing usage. While initial enthusiasm for the Base network has primarily attracted developers and builders, notable interest is growing among larger financial entities. Recently, JPMorgan announced its plan to launch a deposit token on the Base blockchain, showcasing the network’s potential. Ambitious Goals For Coinbase The Base App is designed to enhance monetization options and greater control over their identity and data. As part of this initiative, Coinbase plans to fund creator rewards and waive USDC transaction fees within chat features, although significant revenue generation is not expected immediately. This launch comes at a time when the broader cryptocurrency industry is experiencing a surge in new products, driven by favorable policies from the Trump administration and anticipated regulatory clarity from Congress. Related Reading: Altcoin Season Index Spikes Above 30, But Bitcoin Dominance Remains High, What Next? Last month, Coinbase made headlines with the introduction of its first credit card in partnership with American Express, while Shopify rolled out USDC-powered payment solutions through Coinbase and Stripe. Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong has expressed ambitious goals for the company, aiming to position USDC as the world’s leading stablecoin, currently dominated by Tether’s USDT. He also envisions transforming Coinbase into the premier financial services app globally within the next five to ten years. As of writing, the exchange’s stock, COIN, is trading at $398, slightly down from its all-time high of $405, which was reached earlier in Wednesday’s trading session. Bitcoin (BTC) and other major cryptocurrencies have also shown significant bullish momentum, with prices reaching new records or levels not seen since earlier in the year.
